intro: Juno sindjarensis, commonly known as the Sindjar juniper, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey. It is a coniferous plant belonging to the Cupressaceae family, characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, where it forms dense shrubs or small trees. Its cones are small and woody, containing seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Juno sindjarensis is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat degradation and climate change.
